parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The identifier of this element used to reference it in other components

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: warningAsError
parameter.description: When this preference is enabled, warning messages generated by NetSuite are treated as errors that cause an exception, resulting in rejection of the request.

parameter.name: disableMandatoryCustomFieldValidation
parameter.description: This preference affects the handling of custom fields that are configured in the UI to be mandatory. If you set this preference to true, the fields are not treated as required during SOAP web services requests. If the preference is set to false, the fields are required.

parameter.name: disableSystemNotesForCustomFields
parameter.description: System notes are system-generated records that track changes to a record, including changes to specific field values. This preference lets you disable the creation of system notes for changes to custom fields. Depending on your integration, using this preference may increase performance.

parameter.name: ignoreReadOnlyFields
parameter.description: This preference affects the way the system behaves when you mistakenly submit a value for a read-only field. If you set this preference to true, the system ignores these mistakes.

parameter.name: runServerSuiteScriptAndTriggerWorkflows
parameter.description: By using the runServerSuiteScriptAndTriggerWorkflows preference, you can control SuiteScript and trigger workflows per request. If you do not include this preference in a request, the company preference set on the Web Services Preferences page is used. If you include this preference in the request, it overrides the company preference set in the UI.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.description: Separator used to generate the keys required to provided a better support for custom fields/records. If the script Id of the customization that defines a custom field/record contains the separator default character, setup a new one and regenerate the metadata.

parameter.name: maximumConnections
parameter.description: The maximum amount of connections that can be active to execute the http requests. If this is not set, the default is -1 which does not limit the amount of connections to the server

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the amount of time that the client will wait for a response before it times out. 0 specifies that the client will wait indefinitely.

parameter.name: readTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: The time unit for Read Timeout.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the amount of time that the client will attempt to establish a connection before it times out. 0 specifies that the client will continue to attempt to open a connection indefinitely.

parameter.name: connectionTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: The time unit for Connection Timeout.

parameter.name: tlsContext
parameter.description: Protocol to use for communication. Valid values are HTTP and HTTPS. Default value is HTTP. When using HTTPS the HTTP communication is going to be secured using TLS / SSL. If HTTPS was configured as protocol then the user needs to configure at least the keystore in the tls:context child element of this listener-config.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: The hostname of the HTTP proxy e.g. localhost This field also requires the port to be set.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number of the HTTP proxy e.g. 3128. The port number must be specified if the hostname is also specified.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The username which should be supplied to the HTTP proxy on every request to NetSuite. This field is optional, since a user might want to pass through an unauthenticated HTTP proxy.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password which would be supplied to the HTTP proxy on every request to NetSuite. This field is optional, since a user might want to pass through an unauthenticated HTTP proxy.

parameter.name: nonProxyHosts
parameter.description: A list of comma separated hosts against which the proxy should not be used

parameter.name: consumerKey
parameter.description: The consumer key value for the token based authentication enabled integration record being used

parameter.name: consumerSecret
parameter.description: The consumer secret value for the token based authentication enabled integration record being used

parameter.name: tokenId
parameter.description: The token id representing the unique combination of a user and integration generated within the NetSuite environment

parameter.name: tokenSecret
parameter.description: The respective token secret for the user/integration pair

parameter.name: account
parameter.description: NetSuite SuiteTalk WebService account id.

parameter.name: signatureAlgorithm
parameter.description: The algorithm used to compute the SHA hash signature

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

extension.name: NetSuite
extension.description: NetSuite Connector synchronizes data and automates business processes between NetSuite and third party applications, either on-premise or in the cloud. The Connector makes use of the SuiteTalk WSDL to provide SOAP based integration in order to generate NetSuite business objects, make use of different authentication levels, and support error handling.

parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

operation.name: asyncAddList
operation.description: An asynchronous request equivalent to RecordOperations#addList. In asynchronous requests, your client application sends a request to the SuiteTalk Platform where it is placed in a processing queue and handled asynchronously with other requests. Note that all available jobs for each polling period will be processed contiguously. There is no enforced waiting period for a job that is available. Once a job is initiated, a job ID is returned in the Web services response. Your client application can then check on the status and result of the request by referencing the job ID. Note: Asynchronous request JobIDs are valid for 30 days.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The record type for the operation.

parameter.name: message
parameter.description: The async add list request to complete.

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: asyncSearch
operation.description: An asynchronous request equivalent to RecordOperations#search. Searches for all records that match the given criteria, asynchronously. Note, due to the nature of the operation, this does not support paging meaning that only the first page of results would be returned. If no criteria is specified, all records of the given type are retrieved. In asynchronous requests, your client application sends a request to the SuiteTalk Platform where it is placed in a processing queue and handled asynchronously with other requests. Note that all available jobs for each polling period will be processed contiguously. There is no enforced waiting period for a job that is available. Once a job is initiated, a job ID is returned in the Web services response. Your client application can then check on the status and result of the request by referencing the job ID.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The type of search that will render the output metadata.

parameter.name: message
parameter.description: The async search request to complete.

parameter.name: bodyFieldsOnly
parameter.description: Defaults to TRUE and indicates that the information in the body fields of the record are returned significantly improving performance. Any fields in associated lists or sublists are not returned. If the bodyFieldsOnly field is set to FALSE, all fields associated with the record are returned.

parameter.name: returnSearchColumns
parameter.description: Defaults to TRUE, meaning that only search columns will be returned in your search.

parameter.name: pageSize
parameter.description: Maximum amount of results per page.

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getPostingTransactionSummary
operation.description: Used to retrieve a summary of the actual data in an Account. The getPostingTransactionSummary operation allows you to retrieve a summary of the actual data posted to the general ledger in an Account. You can use available filters/fields to generate reports that are similar to what you see when you run financial reports such as a Trial Balance, Balance Sheet, or an Income Statement.

parameter.name: fields
parameter.description: the fields of the operation body

parameter.name: filters
parameter.description: the filters of the operation body

parameter.name: operationId
parameter.description: the operation id

parameter.name: outputMimeType
parameter.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.

parameter.name: config-ref

operation.name: search
operation.description: The search operation is used to execute a search on a specific record type based on a set of criteria. value, and calculate when invoked based on type.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The type of search that will render the output metadata.

parameter.name: message
parameter.description: The search request to complete.

parameter.name: pageSize
parameter.description: Maximum amount of results per page.

parameter.name: limit
parameter.description: Limits the amount of results produced. Limit less than 0 means no limit

parameter.name: bodyFieldsOnly
parameter.description: Defaults to TRUE and indicates that the information in the body fields of the record are returned significantly improving performance. Any fields in associated lists or sublists are not returned. If the bodyFieldsOnly field is set to FALSE, all fields associated with the record are returned.

parameter.name: returnSearchColumns
parameter.description: Defaults to TRUE, meaning that only search columns will be returned in your search.

operation.name: upsert
operation.description: Adds a new instance or to update an instance of a record in NetSuite. The upsert operation is similar to both the add and update operations, but upsert can be run without first determining whether a record exists in NetSuite. A record is identified by its external ID and its record type. If a record of the specified type with a matching external ID exists in the system, it is updated. If it does not exist, a new record is created. Because external ID is mandatory for this operation, upsert is supported only for records that support the external ID field. Also, this operation prohibits the passing of internal ID values.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The record type for the operation.

parameter.name: message
parameter.description: The upsert record request to complete.

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: upsertList
operation.description: This is used to add or update one or more instances of a record type in NetSuite. It is similar to both the addList and updateList operations, but upsert can be run without first determining whether records exist in NetSuite
